page.title: 02The Voe Bakery.
page.content: In 1915 a bakery was built in Voe. No alterations have been made to the original building but new machinery and ovens have been installed. In the early hours of the morning work gets underway at the bakery. The bakers start at 3am and work until 1pm They may have to work longer if they are delayed for some reason e.g. a power cut. Altogether 8 people are employed here.White aprons are worn by the workers and they are not allowed to smoke while working with the bread. Fourteen machines help the bakers to prepare the mixtures and there are two ovens to bake the bread in. After being packed the Voe bread is distributed all over Shetland by the two bakery vans.
